    • Constructor Detail

      • ModelManager

        public ModelManager()
             throws java.io.IOException
        ModelManager Constructor Upon construction of a ModelManager, file I/O are instantly carried out. The data files are first loaded here.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - with LOAD_SETTINGS_FAILED, SETTINGS_PARSE_FAILED, PARSE_FAILED and LOAD_FAILED messages

    • Method Detail

      • addTask

        public void addTask(java.lang.String newTaskName,
                    java.util.Date newStartDate,
                    java.util.Date newEndDate,
                    java.lang.String newPriority,
                    java.lang.Boolean newDoneStatus)
             throws java.io.IOException
        addTask Adds a task into the program data and then writes it into the database file.
        Parameters:
        newTaskName - The name of the new task
        newStartDate - The start date of the new task
        newEndDate - The end date of the new task
        newPriority - The priority level of the new task. If this is not TodoItem.HIGH/MEDIUM/LOW, priority is set to MEDIUM.
        newDoneStatus - The done status of the new task. If this is null, done status is set to false.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - with LOAD_FAILED, PARSE_FAILED, WRITE_FAILED

      • updateTask

        public void updateTask(java.util.UUID itemID,
                       java.lang.Boolean[] parameters,
                       java.lang.String newTaskName,
                       java.util.Date newStartDate,
                       java.util.Date newEndDate,
                       java.lang.String newPriority,
                       java.lang.Boolean newDoneStatus)
                throws java.io.IOException
        updateTask Updates a task within the program data and then updates database file.
        Parameters:
        itemID - The UUID of the item to be updated
        parameters - An array specifying which attribute of the TodoItem to update
        newTaskName - (Can be null) The new task name of the item.
        newStartDate - (Can be null) The new start date of the item.
        newEndDate - (Can be null) The new end date of the item.
        newPriority - (Can be null) The new priority level of the item. If this is not TodoItem.LOW/MEDIUM/HIGH, an assertion error will occur.
        newDoneStatus - (Can be null) The new done status of the item.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - with LOAD_FAILED, PARSE_FAILED, WRITE_FAILED

      • deleteTask

        public TodoItem deleteTask(java.util.UUID itemID)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        deleteTask Deletes a task within the program data and then updates the file.
        Parameters:
        itemID - The UUID of the item to be deleted
        Returns:
        The deleted TodoItem
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - with LOAD_FAILED, PARSE_FAILED, WRITE_FAILED

      • clearTasks

        public void clearTasks()
                throws java.io.IOException
        clearTasks Clears all tasks in the program data and in the database file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - with LOAD_FAILED, PARSE_FAILED, WRITE_FAILED

      • setSortingStyle

        public void setSortingStyle(int newSortingStyle)
        setSortingStyle Changes the sortingStyle in the TodoItemSorter.
        Parameters:
        newSortingStyle - The new sorting style index.

      • getTodoItemList

        public java.util.ArrayList<TodoItem> getTodoItemList()
        getTodoItemList Returns the data held by Model.
        Returns:
        The ArrayList of TodoItems currently in the program memory.

      • getTodoItemIterator

        public java.util.ListIterator<TodoItem> getTodoItemIterator()
        getTodoItemIterator Returns the data held by Model as a ListIterator
        Returns:
        The iterator of the ArrayList of TodoItems currently in the program memory.

      • changeSettings

        public void changeSettings(java.lang.String fileDirectory,
                           java.lang.Boolean randomColorsEnabled,
                           java.lang.Boolean notificationsEnabled)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        changeSettings Changes the settings stored in the FileStorage, and then updates the settings.json file.
        Parameters:
        fileDirectory - The new directory to switch to
        randomColorsEnabled - The new setting for random colors
        notificationsEnabled - The new setting for notifications
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - with WRITE_SETTINGS_FAILED

        public java.lang.String getFileDirectory()
